TopicTitle: [BUG] Runway Island (abandoned airfield) terrain is floating.

Articles.Content:
My terrain settings is set to max. It happens on both directx or opengl even after restarting ksp, it's always there.

Never had anything like this before. Some people say it's okey for them though.. not sure what's wrong here.

Huh, I haven't seen this one yet. Is this only visible from the angle in your pic?

Cheers,

~Claw

Huh, I haven't seen this one yet. Is this only visible from the angle in your pic?

Cheers,

~Claw

No it's visible from every angle as long as you are a little above it.
I can fly through it, so it's just a visual glitch. Also tried to verify cache in steam even deleted the ksp_data folders.. but the glitch still there.
Can you post a DxDiag file, please?

Can you post a DxDiag file, please?

Sure. https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/13532547/DxDiag.txt

Also tried with both SM3 terrain enabled and disabled after restarting ksp, same results.

Fixed my problem. It turns out my settings.cfg (which was generated by the game long time ago) was outdated especially where it has some terrain parameters. So just letting the game generating a new settings.cfg fixed.

It kind of also fixed some explody behaviour with the small landing gears.

It seems it also fixed the extretchy texture syndrome i was having in the mun.

Edited April 29, 2015 by Beduino
